articles.description: As more and more business is conducted from remote locations, attackers are focusing on exploiting key technologies, like Zoom and Microsoft Teams.CyberArk worked with Microsoft Security Research Center after finding the account takeover vulnerability and a f…
articles.content: MUMBAI: After reports of Zoom meetings being hacked into, researchers have now found Microsoft Teams, the video conferencing platform of Microsoft, vulnerable to cyber attacks.Cyber criminals are turning their sights on video conferencing tools as the next ma… [+2604 chars]

articles.title: Vodafone prepaid plans offering 4GB data per day: All you need to know - India Today
articles.description: Vodafone announced double data offers on Rs 299, Rs 449, and Rs 699 prepaid plans that have different validity but all offers 4GB data per day.
articles.content: Telecom giant Vodafone has launched a series of new plans for its customers ever since the lockdown has been announced. The operator has altered many of its existing plans and phased out many. It is now offering as much as 4G per day in some of the plans. Vod… [+1945 chars]

articles.title: Samsung Galaxy J2 Core 2020 Android Go smartphone launched in India - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Samsung’s new Android Go phone comes with an 8-megapixel rear camera, a 2,600mAh battery and 16GB of onboard storage.
articles.content:
Samsung has quietly launched a new Android Go smartphone in India. Galaxy J2 Core 2020 is listed on Samsung India’s official website with its price, specifications and more. 
Samsung Galaxy J2 Core 2020 comes in only one variant with 1GB RAM and 16GB onboard… [+1229 chars]

articles.title: Charging a MacBook on the wrong side can lead to noisy fans and lower performance - TechSpot
articles.description: On the official support page, Apple states that you can charge your MacBook Pro using either one of the USB-C ports. However, it turns out that there are a right way and a wrong way to charge your expensive device,…
articles.content:
In brief: By the looks of it, Apple may be having a new Chargegate on its hands. Several users have found their MacBook Pro has a habit of maxing out the CPU and overheating when charging using the left side ports. 
On the official support page, Apple states… [+2105 chars]
